instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> headphone jack not being recognized.
threads.message:
i have a clients board. something got stuck in headphone jack. and sound was not working either. when you toggle the volume up and down it would have the forbidden sign. replaced jack. and sound works fine. no more forbidden sign. laptop can see headphone jack when i plug it in when the computer starts or when i put in sleep mode. but headphone jack is not being recognized when i unplug and plug in . music plays on speaker rather than headphones. was wondering if anyone would know what the issue might be

thanks in advance

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> headphone jack not being recognized.
threads.message: Loose/burned resistor by the jack from desoldering it. I know this one all too well. Post some pictures close up of the jack area.

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> headphone jack not being recognized.
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R6860</RESISTOR> wasnt outputting correct resistance. dont think it was cause of it. this board alot of corrosion in that area. but yes it is solved. thanks louis
